title: Everyday English Course 114
description: Improve your English comprehension skills through short everyday conversations and situational dialogues.

sections.title: Section 1: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What are the man and the woman talking about?
How many students took IELTS test last month?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Did you see what that guy did?
M: No. I was looking the other way.
W: He made a U turn right in the middle of the block and almost hit a kid on a bicycle.
M: Drivers get crazier every day!
{a}

variables.a: What was the guy doing?

answerOptions: They spent three hundred dollars on their vacation.
They drew money than they should have from the bank.
instances.correctAnswer: They drew money than they should have from the bank.

variables.a: What are they talking about?
Where are the woman's reading glasses?

answerOptions: The man is a fan of world-famous football players.
The man's football career seems to be at an end.
The man was operated on a few weeks ago.
instances.correctAnswer: The man is a fan of world-famous football players.

variables.a: What do we learn from the conversation?
Where does this dialogue probably take place?
At what time does the train to Leeds leave?
What happened to the man?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Oh, John, I didn't tell you. My sister phoned yesterday. She wants to get married.
M: Married? She is only seventeen!
W: That's the reason she told me why she wants to get married.
{a}

answerOptions: She is not old enough to get married.
She is too old to get married.
instances.correctAnswer: She is not old enough to get married.

variables.a: What does John think of the woman's sister?

sections.title: Section 2: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

variables.a: What does Jenny decide to do first?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Mary, how many languages can you speak? Apart from English, of course.
W: I speak German very well, and I can also write in German.
M: Any other languages?
W: I can speak a little French. I can't speak it very fast, thought.
{a}

variables.a: How many languages can the woman speak altogether?

answerOptions: The exam was difficult for the woman.
The woman finished the exam in one hour.
The woman thought the exam easy.
instances.correctAnswer: The woman thought the exam easy.

variables.a: What can we conclude from the talk?

answerOptions: Go to the railway station earlier.

variables.a: What does the man suggest they should do?

answerOptions: The selection process was a little unfair.
He had long dreamed of the dean's position.
Rod was eliminated in the selection process.
instances.correctAnswer: Rod was eliminated in the selection process.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

questionTemplates.text:
W: Did you see the purse, honey?
M: Your purse? No. Why the purse? We're not going shopping anyway.
W: I know. But our opera tickets are in it. And we have only one hour left.
M: Did you have it when we left the parking lot?
{a}

variables.a: Where did the speakers plan to go?

answerOptions: Kathy will be at the party.
Kathy is too busy to come.
Kathy is going to be invited.
instances.correctAnswer: Kathy will be at the party.

variables.a: What does the woman mean?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Are we still going to the football game tonight?
W: Oh, sorry, I totally forgot about it. I've arranged to go with a friend to a new Chinese restaurant downtown. How about joining us?
M: Sure I'd love to.
{a}

variables.a: What is the man going to do?

answerOptions: The requirements of an M. A. degree.
The credit hours required for an M. A. degree.
instances.correctAnswer: The credit hours required for an M. A. degree.

variables.a: What are they talking about?
What are they talking about?

sections.title: Section 3: English Practice
sections.description: Learn to understand and respond to basic English dialogues used in daily situations.

answerOptions: The man is a diligent student.
The man has bad study habits.
The man has made a mess of his midtermexam.
instances.correctAnswer: The man has bad study habits.

variables.a: What does the woman imply?

answerOptions: The man bought a camera from this shop before.
The man doesn't seem to buy the camera.
The shop is out of cameras.
instances.correctAnswer: The man doesn't seem to buy the camera.

variables.a: What do we know from this dialogue?
What are they talking about?

answerOptions: He is working for a business company.
He is doing his own business.
He is studying at a university.
instances.correctAnswer: He is studying at a university.

variables.a: What is the man probably doing now?

questionTemplates.text:
W: I heard you caught a cold. How are you feeling today?
M: I can't complain. At least I'm out of bed.
W: Take it easy. You should drink more water or milk.
{a}

variables.a: How is the man today?

questionTemplates.text:
M: Lucy, would you like to go to the cinema with me this Friday night?
W: I'd like to, Mike. But I have to meet Alice at the airport. How about Saturday night?
M: OK. See you then.
{a}

variables.a: Who will the woman meet on Friday night?

answerOptions: He wants to know the woman's plan.
He has a meeting on Tuesday.
He wants to go to the cinema.
instances.correctAnswer: He wants to know the woman's plan.

variables.a: What does the man mean?

answerOptions: He thinks it's too far away from his home.
He thinks the pay is too low.
He doesn't want to spend too much time working.
instances.correctAnswer: He thinks it's too far away from his home.

variables.a: Why doesn't the man want to accept the job?
What does the man think about John?
